<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>We’ve been running giveaways for the better part of the four years I’ve been at Morning Brew, ranging from MacBooks to vacations. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So, it seems to me you could lock in the backpack by racking up 5 referrals in the next few hours, while also putting your hat in the ring for free Nuggs. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/22/full-vaccine-approval-pfizer-expected-soon-today?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Clear Eyes, Full Approval, Can’t Lose
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/22/full-vaccine-approval-pfizer-expected-soon-today?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="NEW YORK, NY - NOVEMBER 09: A sign for Pfizer is seen outside the Pfizer..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MzUxL3BmaXplcl9jb3ZpZC0xOV92YWNjaW5lX2QuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>David Dee Delgado/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The FDA could grant full approval to Pfizer-BioNTech’s coronavirus vaccine <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/20/us/politics/fda-pfizer-covid-vaccine-full-approval.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as soon as today</a>, according to the NYT. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s a milestone that’s up there with a couple’s first “I love you” exchange. Full approval will likely lead to more vaccine requirements among organizations and businesses, and, officials hope, will build more confidence among skeptical Americans to get the shot voluntarily. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Right now, three US-made vaccines—Pfizer, Moderna, and J&J—have been authorized for emergency use only. So what does “full approval” have that “emergency use” doesn’t?</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">More data: </strong></span><span>Emergency use authorization was given following a clinical trial of more than 40,000 people and an average follow-up time of two months. For full approval, regulators want to follow up with people who’ve received a vaccine </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2021/08/02/coronavirus-vaccines-fda-full-approval-timeline/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">after six months</a></span><span>. So, in effect, you go from tens of thousands of pages for review to hundreds of thousands, according to FDA vaccine overseer Peter Marks. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">More manufacturing scrutiny: </strong></span><span>Full approval requires more inspections of facilities and vaccine makers to provide more detailed production info, per Marks. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What could happen next</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Organizations may feel <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/09/health/covid-19-fda-approval-meaning/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">empowered</a> to introduce vaccine requirements where they’ve hesitated before. Businesses are allowed by law to require their employees to get the shot (and many have requirements in place already), but full approval offers a bulletproof legal vest. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>More hospitals and universities are also expected to roll out mandates. The University of Minnesota, for example, said it would </span><span><a href="https://www.startribune.com/university-of-minnesota-to-require-covid-vaccinations-for-students-once-shots-receive-fda-approval/600086330/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">require vaccination</a></span><span> among its Golden Gophers once full approval is handed down.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hesitant Americans might also be more willing to get a jab on their own. 30% of unvaccinated adults said they’d be more likely to get a vaccine once it was fully FDA approved, according to a Kaiser Family Foundation <a href="https://www.kff.org/coronavirus-covid-19/poll-finding/kff-covid-19-vaccine-monitor-june-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">study</a> from June. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But most US adults simply don’t have all the information. In the same survey, two-thirds either said they believed that the vaccines had full approval already or didn’t know the vaccines’ approval status.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the next vaccine to be considered for full approval is Moderna’s, which could come a few weeks after Pfizer’s green light.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/22/pentagon-calls-commercial-airlines-lend-18-planes-evacuation-effort?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Airlines to the Pentagon
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/22/pentagon-calls-commercial-airlines-lend-18-planes-evacuation-effort?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Bill Murray in Space Jam" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0ErK5H6exTmBN7ri/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e472k2gpqlyzi7jmc2dv8tmzmpd9gmo1p61o5syjhgt&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Bill Murray in Space Jam" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0ErK5H6exTmBN7ri/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e472k2gpqlyzi7jmc2dv8tmzmpd9gmo1p61o5syjhgt&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Space Jam</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The US government needs a little private sector muscle to help with its mammoth evacuation effort in Afghanistan. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Sunday, the Pentagon <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/biden-administration-use-commercial-airlines-carry-afghan-evacuees-2021-08-22/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ordered</a> six commercial airlines, including United, American, and Delta, to provide 18 planes in order to shuttle evacuees from air bases in Germany and Qatar to their final destinations. No commercial jets will land in Afghanistan’s capital, Kabul.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How can it do that? </strong>Following the Berlin airlift post-WWII, the government created the Civil Reserve Air Fleet, which allows it to compel airlines to lend a fuselage in emergency times. The order is similar to when the government forced manufacturers to make ventilators in the early days of the pandemic.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Civil Reserve Air Fleet is a bit rusty. It’s only been activated </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/pentagon-tells-airlines-to-help-fly-afghan-evacuees-from-foreign-bases-11629632843?mod=hp_lead_pos7" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two times</a></span><span> in history, in Kuwait in 1990–1991 and Iraq in 2002–2003.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>President Biden has committed to airlift all Americans and Afghan allies who want to leave Afghanistan, but the area around the Kabul airport has remained chaotic and violent, as Taliban fighters mix with desperate Afghans hoping to leave the country. Seven Afghan civilians died on Saturday in the crush of people trying to enter the airport. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/23/justin-sun-buys-nft-rock-half-million-dollars?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

<img alt="Justin Sun tweet about an NFT he bought" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MzUyL2p1c3Rpbl9zdW5fcGV0X3JvY2sucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Justin Sun on Twitter</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Actually, 31-year-old crypto mogul Justin Sun <a href="https://beincrypto.com/tron-founder-joins-nft-craze-with-600k-etherrock-purchase/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spent $611,710</a> to buy an EtherRock NFT yesterday. And he can’t even take it home and pet it. Because it’s literally just a Clipart of a rock.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on: </strong>EtherRocks are one of the latest crazes in the world of NFTs (non-fungible tokens), which allow people to acquire ownership of digital assets using blockchain technology. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So why would you want to own one?</strong> The same reason you’d buy a rare baseball card—the originals are scarce and some people believe they have tremendous value. EtherRock was one of the <a href="https://www.techtimes.com/articles/264307/20210819/nft-rocks-called-etherrock-selling-six-digit-prices.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">earliest NFT projects</a> from way back in 2017.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“These virtual rocks serve NO PURPOSE beyond being able to be brought and sold, and giving you a strong sense of pride in being an owner of 1 of the only 100 rocks in the game :)” the EtherRock website states.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As of yesterday, the <a href="https://twitter.com/etherrockprice/status/1429366865512460292?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cheapest</a> EtherRock available was selling for 321.12 ether, or $1.05 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Reports of NFTs’ deaths have been greatly exaggerated, and after a short lull demand has soared this summer. OpenSea, for instance, became the first NFT marketplace to <a href="https://www.theblockcrypto.com/linked/115222/opensea-is-first-nft-marketplace-to-pass-1-billion-in-monthly-trading-volume?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pass $1 billion</a> in monthly trading volume this month. The platform had just over 300 users in January 2021...now it has nearly 26,000.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong><em>Black Widow</em> earned <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/business-news/disney-makes-first-move-in-scarlett-johanssons-black-widow-suit-1235001093/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $125 million</a> in online revenue (streaming, downloads, etc.), compared to $367 million at the global box office. Disney released the stats as it aims to take Scarlett Johansson’s lawsuit, which claims Disney breached its contract with the star by releasing the film simultaneously on streaming devices and in theaters, to arbitration instead of a civil trial.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“You are not a horse. You are not a cow. Seriously, y’all. Stop it.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A tweet by the FDA that <a href="https://twitter.com/US_FDA/status/1429050070243192839?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Etweet" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">implored</a> people to stop self-medicating against Covid-19 with a drug called ivermectin. Ivermectin is typically given to livestock for deworming purposes, but enough people have been taking it recently that the FDA and Mississippi’s state epidemiologist have issued warnings.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Searing reflections on Afghanistan. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Jackson Hole:</strong> The final approach into the Jackson Hole, WY, airport is one of the most stunning in the world. Unfortunately, no central bankers will be landing there this week after their annual symposium <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/20/fed-officials-will-seek-to-avoid-a-tantrum-as-they-keep-taper-talk-going-at-jackson-hole.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">moved online</a> due to Covid. It’ll still be noteworthy—tune in for Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s keynote address on Friday for clues on when the Fed will begin winding down its Covid-era stimulus programs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>The Q2 earnings train rolls on, but with most big companies having reported already, we’re nearly at the caboose. Salesforce, Snowflake, Peloton, Best Buy, Gap, and Dollar General round out the schedule this week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A tradition unlike any other: Starbucks is expected to drop its Pumpkin Spice Latte offerings on Tuesday. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo will officially step down Monday night amid a sexual harassment scandal.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The college football season kicks off on Saturday.</span></li>
</ul>

class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"NEW YORK, NY - NOVEMBER 09: A sign for Pfizer is seen outside the Pfizer...\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe FDA could grant full approval to Pfizer-BioNTech’s coronavirus vaccine \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/20/us/politics/fda-pfizer-covid-vaccine-full-approval.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eas soon as today\u003c/a\u003e, according to the NYT. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s a milestone that’s up there with a couple’s first “I love you” exchange. Full approval will likely lead to more vaccine requirements among organizations and businesses, and, officials hope, will build more confidence among skeptical Americans to get the shot voluntarily. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRight now, three US-made vaccines—Pfizer, Moderna, and J\u0026J—have been authorized for emergency use only. So what does “full approval” have that “emergency use” doesn’t?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore data: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEmergency use authorization was given following a clinical trial of more than 40,000 people and an average follow-up time of two months. For full approval, regulators want to follow up with people who’ve received a vaccine \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2021/08/02/coronavirus-vaccines-fda-full-approval-timeline/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eafter six months\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. So, in effect, you go from tens of thousands of pages for review to hundreds of thousands, according to FDA vaccine overseer Peter Marks. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore manufacturing scrutiny: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFull approval requires more inspections of facilities and vaccine makers to provide more detailed production info, per Marks. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat could happen next\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOrganizations may feel \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/09/health/covid-19-fda-approval-meaning/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eempowered\u003c/a\u003e to introduce vaccine requirements where they’ve hesitated before. Businesses are allowed by law to require their employees to get the shot (and many have requirements in place already), but full approval offers a bulletproof legal vest. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMore hospitals and universities are also expected to roll out mandates. The University of Minnesota, for example, said it would \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.startribune.com/university-of-minnesota-to-require-covid-vaccinations-for-students-once-shots-receive-fda-approval/600086330/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequire vaccination\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e among its Golden Gophers once full approval is handed down.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHesitant Americans might also be more willing to get a jab on their own. 30% of unvaccinated adults said they’d be more likely to get a vaccine once it was fully FDA approved, according to a Kaiser Family Foundation \u003ca href=\"https://www.kff.org/coronavirus-covid-19/poll-finding/kff-covid-19-vaccine-monitor-june-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estudy\u003c/a\u003e from June. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut most US adults simply don’t have all the information. In the same survey, two-thirds either said they believed that the vaccines had full approval already or didn’t know the vaccines’ approval status.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe next vaccine to be considered for full approval is Moderna’s, which could come a few weeks after Pfizer’s green light.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe US government needs a little private sector muscle to help with its mammoth evacuation effort in Afghanistan. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Sunday, the Pentagon \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/biden-administration-use-commercial-airlines-carry-afghan-evacuees-2021-08-22/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eordered\u003c/a\u003e six commercial airlines, including United, American, and Delta, to provide 18 planes in order to shuttle evacuees from air bases in Germany and Qatar to their final destinations. No commercial jets will land in Afghanistan’s capital, Kabul.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow can it do that? \u003c/strong\u003eFollowing the Berlin airlift post-WWII, the government created the Civil Reserve Air Fleet, which allows it to compel airlines to lend a fuselage in emergency times. The order is similar to when the government forced manufacturers to make ventilators in the early days of the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe Civil Reserve Air Fleet is a bit rusty. It’s only been activated \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/pentagon-tells-airlines-to-help-fly-afghan-evacuees-from-foreign-bases-11629632843?mod=hp_lead_pos7\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etwo times\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in history, in Kuwait in 1990–1991 and Iraq in 2002–2003.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003ePresident Biden has committed to airlift all Americans and Afghan allies who want to leave Afghanistan, but the area around the Kabul airport has remained chaotic and violent, as Taliban fighters mix with desperate Afghans hoping to leave the country. Seven Afghan civilians died on Saturday in the crush of people trying to enter the airport. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
